info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 11:31AM EDT until March 31 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN INDIANA...SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER...NORTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND AND ARMSTRONG COUNTIES... At 1131 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sarver to near White Oak, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Vandergrift, Kittanning, Apollo, Plum, Murrysville, New Kensington, Lower Burrell, Harrison Township, Natrona Heights, Brackenridge, and Trafford. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
